definition: scissors/shears/clippers/CL:把[ba3]/to cut with scissors/to trim/to wipe out or exterminate

sentences.english: The silhouette of a costume is its overall outline or contour.
sentences.chinese: 廓形是一件衣服的外轮廓线或者剪影。

sentences.english: In the boundless twilight, this herd of beautiful creatures are silhouetted by the rays of evening sunshine.
sentences.chinese: 暮色苍茫中，这一群美生灵被霞光勾勒出一片剪影。

sentences.english: Classic canvas upper in a mid-cut silhouette for added style appeal.
sentences.chinese: 经典帆布鞋面为补充的风格上诉中旬剪影。

sentences.english: The Apostles' Creed contains a short summary of Jesus' life.
sentences.chinese: 使徒信经中包含有耶稣一生的剪影。

sentences.english: Like figures in a shadow theater, silhouettes of prey show through a Philippine pitcher plant.
sentences.chinese: 菲律宾猪笼草猎物剪影，有点像皮影戏。

sentences.english: That is truly in love with trivia .
Silhouette No. 7, for piano in B minor.
sentences.chinese: b小调为钢琴而作的第7剪影。

sentences.english: A blood-red sun rose over the silhouettes of distant hills.
sentences.chinese: 一轮血色红日升起，远山成了剪影。

sentences.english: Cool canvas upper in an oxford silhouette for a timeless investment.
sentences.chinese: 酷帆布鞋面在牛津大学一个永恒的投资剪影。

sentences.english: Silhouette photography is extremely bold and striking example of the art-form.
sentences.chinese: 剪影摄影是非常大胆和惊人的艺术形式的例子。

sentences.english: Her cell-phone screen saver is a silhouette of the state of Iraq.
sentences.chinese: 她手机用的壁纸是伊拉克地图的剪影。

sentences.english: A cardboard cutout of a cheerful Albert Einstein greets visitors.
sentences.chinese: 一个面露笑容的爱因斯坦的纸板剪影和读者打招呼。

sentences.english: The all-mountain Roxy Silhouette snowboard will have you turning heads as you carve pristine lines all day long.
sentences.chinese: 全山罗克西剪影滑雪将你把你元首质朴线雕整天。

sentences.english: Genuine leather upper with cutout detail at the vamp for much added appeal.
sentences.chinese: 真皮与剪影细节上多增加的上诉鞋面。

sentences.english: Richard demonstrating how to take silhouette at Treasure Island.
sentences.chinese: 杨军在金银岛示范拍摄剪影。

definition: the sun sets in the west (idiom)
night scene/the dim light of night
rear view/figure seen from behind/view of the back (of a person or object)
